body: Thanks for the note! Some discussion is already underway here https://github.com/serilog/serilog/pull/332 but needs some more input. Thanks~
The distinction is that I want to construct separate loggers (i.e. for different purposes), rather than log to multiple sinks of the same type.
Ah I see - thanks for the clarification.

Hi Andrew - thanks again for logging this; I think the best option currently is to copy/customize the appsettings support for your scenario (I expect somewhere along the line we may go further towards this, but for now I think the configuration system needs more "bake time" before we start extending it). Cheers!

@nblumhardt having the same need. Two different logger configurations, both configured from appsettings but with different variations. With the current release, what is the recommended way to handle this? Gist/docs?

+1 I would love something like what is being proposed here (a prefix).

I have cases where I'm deploying more than one app in the same pipeline (e.g. client and server), and I'm not able to use config/variables transforms because they would apply the same values to both packages and they should have different log configurations each.

Having a prefix would solve that. At the moment I had to give up on using the AppSettings and had to write my own version of it w/ custom appSettings items using a prefix.
Reopening again, thanks for all the feedback. (This might be a good candidate for a PR on the `dev-v2` branch if anyone is interested.)

issue.title: Add support for multiple sets of AppSettings using custom prefixes
issue.body: Add support for multiple sets of AppSettings using custom prefixes. Resolves #430

issue.title: Add support for multiple sets of AppSettings using custom prefixes (in v2)
issue.body: Add support for multiple sets of AppSettings using custom prefixes (in v2). Resolves #430

body:
I've just opened 2 PRs:

#550 targets v1.5 / `dev`
#551 targets v2.0 / `dev-v2`

Let me know what you think.

Cheers,
Caio Proiete

@caioproiete thanks very much for the PRs, looking good.

Given that it's a binary breaking change (added parameter on the `AppSettings()` method, and it's late in the 1.5.x cycle, I'd prefer making the change in v2 only (still several months away I think). Would that be a huge inconvenience? // cc @serilog/core
